title: Hustler's Larry Flynt on Playboy Nixing Nudity - Hugh Hefner Has "Lost His Mind"
text:
Last week, Playboy announced it would get rid of its iconic feature: nude photos of its Playmates. Hugh Hefner and the magazine's staff made the change in an attempt to boost sales, especially since naked photos of women are now so easily accessible online.
But one fellow media mogul doesn't think it will work. Larry Flynt, publisher of the pornographic Hustler magazine, told CNN that the move was absolutely insane, and could harm Playboy 's business model.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below "Hefner's 90 now," Flynt, 72, said. (Hefner is actually 89, for the record.) "I knew he was getting old, but I didn't know he had lost his mind." Flynt said that nudity was Playboy 's most "important" and "notorious" feature, and that it was "a silly move" to get rid of what the magazine is known for.
He added that Hefner needs to run his magazine like a businessman, not like an artist, and cut editorial staff in order to boost profits. "Nobody can ever deny this guy that he paved the way for the sexual revolution, but he will not be remembered for his business acumen," he said.
Flynt has been making the media rounds lately to weigh in on Playboy 's decision, but he says he's never viewed Hefner as competition. "I don't think they were ever a competitor," Flynt told CNNMoney. "My only competitor is Gynecological Monthly ."
